1‚Üí# React Hero Section Component 2‚Üí 3‚Üí## What This Demonstrates 4‚Üí 5‚ÜíThis example showcases a production-ready Hero Section component built with React and plain CSS. The component features a modern gradient background, navigation menu with hover effects, a grid of clickable starter pack cards with smooth animations, and an MLH official badge. It demonstrates best practices for component structure, accessibility, error handling, and responsive design while maintaining simplicity by avoiding CSS frameworks. 6‚Üí 7‚Üí## Original Source 8‚Üí 9‚Üí**Repository:** Custom implementation based on specifications 10‚Üí**Original location:** Built from scratch following the provided requirements 11‚Üí 12‚ÜíKey implementation details: 13‚Üí- Uses React functional components with hooks 14‚Üí- Implements plain CSS for all styling (no Tailwind, CSS Modules, or styled-components) 15‚Üí- Static content with configurable props for flexibility 16‚Üí- Comprehensive error handling for image loading failures 17‚Üí- Smooth animations and transitions for enhanced UX 18‚Üí 19‚Üí## Live Preview 20‚Üí 21‚ÜíTo see this in action: 22‚Üí```bash 23‚Üínpm run dev 24‚Üí# Navigate to /extracted 25‚Üí``` 26‚Üí 27‚Üí## Dependencies Required 28‚Üí 29‚Üí### NPM Packages 30‚Üí 31‚ÜíThis component uses only React (already included in Next.js). No additional dependencies are required. 32‚Üí 33‚Üí**Why:** 34‚Üí- Pure React implementation with no external UI libraries 35‚Üí- Plain CSS for styling (no CSS-in-JS libraries needed) 36‚Üí- Uses native browser APIs for all functionality 37‚Üí 38‚Üí## Code Organization 39‚Üí 40‚Üí``` 41‚Üísrc/app/extracted/ 42‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ page.tsx # Main demo page 43‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ components/ 44‚Üí‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ HeroSection.tsx # The Hero Section component 45‚Üí‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ HeroSection.css # Component styles (plain CSS) 46‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ types.ts # TypeScript type definitions 47‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ utils.ts # Mock data and utility functions 48‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md # This file 49‚Üí``` 50‚Üí 51‚Üí## What's Mocked 52‚Üí 53‚Üí### Starter Pack Data 54‚ÜíThe component uses mock starter pack data with Unsplash placeholder images: 55‚Üí```typescript 56‚Üí// In utils.ts 57‚Üíexport const MOCK_STARTER_PACKS: StarterPack[] = [ 58‚Üí { 59‚Üí imageUrl: 'https://images.unsplash.com/...', 60‚Üí linkUrl: '#web-development', 61‚Üí title: 'Web Development Starter', 62‚Üí description: 'HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React' 63‚Üí }, 64‚Üí // ... more starter packs 65‚Üí] 66‚Üí``` 67‚Üí 68‚Üí### Navigation Links 69‚ÜíStatic navigation links are provided for demonstration: 70‚Üí```typescript 71‚Üíexport const NAVIGATION_LINKS: NavigationLink[] = [ 72‚Üí { label: 'Home', href: '#home' }, 73‚Üí { label: 'About', href: '#about' }, 74‚Üí // ... more links 75‚Üí] 76‚Üí``` 77‚Üí 78‚Üí### MLH Badge 79‚ÜíUses the official MLH logo from their CDN: 80‚Üí```typescript 81‚Üíexport const MLH_BADGE_URL = 'https://static.mlh.io/brand-assets/logo/official/mlh-logo-color.png'; 82‚Üí``` 83‚Üí 84‚Üí## How to Integrate Into Your App 85‚Üí 86‚Üí1. **Copy the component files** to your project: 87‚Üí - Copy `components/HeroSection.tsx` 88‚Üí - Copy `components/HeroSection.css` 89‚Üí - Copy `types.ts` 90‚Üí 91‚Üí2. **Replace mock data with real data:** 92‚Üí 93‚Üí```typescript 94‚Üí// Before (mocked) 95‚Üíimport { MOCK_STARTER_PACKS } from './utils'; 96‚Üí 97‚Üí 98‚Üí// After (real data from your API/database) 99‚Üíconst starterPacks = await fetch('/api/starter-packs').then(r => r.json()); 100‚Üí 101‚Üí``` 102‚Üí 103‚Üí3. **Customize the navigation links:** 104‚Üí 105‚Üí```typescript 106‚Üí// Edit the links directly in HeroSection.tsx 107‚Üí
108‚Üí
    109‚Üí
  • Home
    • 110‚Üí
  • About
    • 111‚Üí {/* Add your custom links */} 112‚Üí
113‚Üí
114‚Üí``` 115‚Üí 116‚Üí4. **Update the title and description:** 117‚Üí 118‚Üí```typescript 119‚Üí// Edit the content in HeroSection.tsx 120‚Üí

Your Custom Title

121‚Üí

122‚Üí Your custom description text here. 123‚Üí

124‚Üí``` 125‚Üí 126‚Üí## Key Features 127‚Üí 128‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Navigation with hover effects** - Links darken on hover with 200ms transition 129‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Responsive grid layout** - Starter packs displayed in a flexible grid 130‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Smooth animations** - Fade-in effects for content, staggered card animations 131‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Interactive cards** - Hover effects with scale and shadow transitions 132‚Üí- ‚úÖ **MLH badge integration** - Official 2026 season badge displayed 133‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Error handling** - Fallback images for broken links 134‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Accessible** - Keyboard navigation, ARIA labels, semantic HTML 135‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Loading states** - Lazy loading for images 136‚Üí- ‚úÖ **TypeScript** - Full type safety with comprehensive interfaces 137‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Self-contained** - No external dependencies beyond React 138‚Üí 139‚Üí## Customization 140‚Üí 141‚Üí### Colors 142‚Üí 143‚ÜíEdit the CSS variables in `HeroSection.css`: 144‚Üí 145‚Üí```css 146‚Üí/* Current gradient */ 147‚Üíbackground: linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea 0%, #764ba2 100%); 148‚Üí 149‚Üí/* Change to your brand colors */ 150‚Üíbackground: linear-gradient(135deg, #your-color-1 0%, #your-color-2 100%); 151‚Üí``` 152‚Üí 153‚Üí### Typography 154‚Üí 155‚ÜíModify font sizes and weights in `HeroSection.css`: 156‚Üí 157‚Üí```css 158‚Üí.hero-title { 159‚Üí font-size: 3rem; /* Adjust size */ 160‚Üí font-weight: 700; /* Adjust weight */ 161‚Üí} 162‚Üí``` 163‚Üí 164‚Üí### Layout 165‚Üí 166‚ÜíAdjust grid columns in `HeroSection.css`: 167‚Üí 168‚Üí```css 169‚Üí.starter-packs-grid { 170‚Üí grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(300px, 1fr)); 171‚Üí /* Change minmax value to adjust card width */ 172‚Üí} 173‚Üí``` 174‚Üí 175‚Üí### Animations 176‚Üí 177‚ÜíControl animation timing in `HeroSection.css`: 178‚Üí 179‚Üí```css 180‚Üí.nav-link { 181‚Üí transition: background-color 200ms ease-in-out; # React Hero Section Component ## What This Demonstrates This example showcases a production-ready Hero Section component built with React and plain CSS. The component features a modern gradient background, navigation menu with hover effects, a grid of clickable starter pack cards with smooth animations, and an MLH official badge. It demonstrates best practices for component structure, accessibility, error handling, and responsive design while maintaining simplicity by avoiding CSS frameworks. ## Original Source **Repository:** Custom implementation based on specifications **Original location:** Built from scratch following the provided requirements Key implementation details: - Uses React functional components with hooks - Implements plain CSS for all styling (no Tailwind, CSS Modules, or styled-components) - Static content with configurable props for flexibility - Comprehensive error handling for image loading failures - Smooth animations and transitions for enhanced UX ## Live Preview To see this in action: ```bash npm run dev # Navigate to /extracted ``` ## Dependencies Required ### NPM Packages This component uses only React (already included in Next.js). No additional dependencies are required. **Why:** - Pure React implementation with no external UI libraries - Plain CSS for styling (no CSS-in-JS libraries needed) - Uses native browser APIs for all functionality ## Code Organization ``` src/app/extracted/ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ page.tsx # Main demo page ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ components/ ‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ HeroSection.tsx # The Hero Section component ‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ HeroSection.css # Component styles (plain CSS) ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ types.ts # TypeScript type definitions ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ utils.ts # Mock data and utility functions ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md # This file ``` ## What's Mocked ### Starter Pack Data The component uses mock starter pack data with Unsplash placeholder images: ```typescript // In utils.ts export const MOCK_STARTER_PACKS: StarterPack[] = [ { imageUrl: 'https://images.unsplash.com/...', linkUrl: '#web-development', title: 'Web Development Starter', description: 'HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React' }, // ... more starter packs ] ``` ### Navigation Links Static navigation links are provided for demonstration: ```typescript export const NAVIGATION_LINKS: NavigationLink[] = [ { label: 'Home', href: '#home' }, { label: 'About', href: '#about' }, // ... more links ] ``` ### MLH Badge Uses the official MLH logo from their CDN: ```typescript export const MLH_BADGE_URL = 'https://static.mlh.io/brand-assets/logo/official/mlh-logo-color.png'; ``` ## How to Integrate Into Your App 1. **Copy the component files** to your project: - Copy `components/HeroSection.tsx` - Copy `components/HeroSection.css` - Copy `types.ts` 2. **Replace mock data with real data:** ```typescript // Before (mocked) import { MOCK_STARTER_PACKS } from './utils'; // After (real data from your API/database) const starterPacks = await fetch('/api/starter-packs').then(r => r.json()); ``` 3. **Customize the navigation links:** ```typescript // Edit the links directly in HeroSection.tsx
  • Home
  • About
    • {/* Add your custom links */}
``` 4. **Update the title and description:** ```typescript // Edit the content in HeroSection.tsx

Your Custom Title

Your custom description text here.

``` ## Key Features - ‚úÖ **Navigation with hover effects** - Links darken on hover with 200ms transition - ‚úÖ **Responsive grid layout** - Starter packs displayed in a flexible grid - ‚úÖ **Smooth animations** - Fade-in effects for content, staggered card animations - ‚úÖ **Interactive cards** - Hover effects with scale and shadow transitions - ‚úÖ **MLH badge integration** - Official 2026 season badge displayed - ‚úÖ **Error handling** - Fallback images for broken links - ‚úÖ **Accessible** - Keyboard navigation, ARIA labels, semantic HTML - ‚úÖ **Loading states** - Lazy loading for images - ‚úÖ **TypeScript** - Full type safety with comprehensive interfaces - ‚úÖ **Self-contained** - No external dependencies beyond React ## Customization ### Colors Edit the CSS variables in `HeroSection.css`: ```css /* Current gradient */ background: linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea 0%, #764ba2 100%); /* Change to your brand colors */ background: linear-gradient(135deg, #your-color-1 0%, #your-color-2 100%); ``` ### Typography Modify font sizes and weights in `HeroSection.css`: ```css .hero-title { font-size: 3rem; /* Adjust size */ font-weight: 700; /* Adjust weight */ } ``` ### Layout Adjust grid columns in `HeroSection.css`: ```css .starter-packs-grid { grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fill, minmax(300px, 1fr)); /* Change minmax value to adjust card width */ } ``` ### Animations Control animation timing in `HeroSection.css`: ```css .nav-link { transition: background-color 200ms ease-in-out; /* Adjust duration: 100ms, 300ms, etc. */ } .starter-pack-card { transition: transform 300ms ease-in-out; /* Adjust for faster/slower hover effects */ } ``` ### Starter Pack Count Simply pass different data to the component: ```typescript // Show 3 packs // Show all packs // Dynamic based on user preference ``` ## Component Props ### HeroSectionProps ```typescript interface HeroSectionProps { starterPacks: StarterPack[]; // Array of starter pack objects } ``` ### StarterPack ```typescript interface StarterPack { imageUrl: string; // URL to the pack image linkUrl: string; // URL to navigate on click title: string; // Pack title (displayed below image) description?: string; // Optional description } ``` ## Styling Architecture The component uses **plain CSS** with the following approach: - **No preprocessors** - Pure CSS for maximum compatibility - **No CSS-in-JS** - Separate CSS file for clarity - **BEM-inspired naming** - Clear, descriptive class names - **No global styles** - All styles scoped to component classes - **Responsive** - Works on desktop/laptop screens (as per requirements) ## Browser Support - ‚úÖ Chrome/Edge (latest) - ‚úÖ Firefox (latest) - ‚úÖ Safari (latest) - ‚úÖ Modern browsers with CSS Grid support ## Accessibility Features - **Semantic HTML** - Proper use of `
`, `
`, `` tags - **ARIA labels** - Descriptive labels for screen readers - **Keyboard navigation** - All interactive elements accessible via keyboard - **Focus indicators** - Clear focus outlines for keyboard users - **Alt text** - All images have descriptive alt attributes - **Color contrast** - Sufficient contrast for text readability ## Troubleshooting ### Issue: Images not loading **Solution:** Check that image URLs are valid and accessible: ```typescript // The component handles errors automatically with fallback images // But you can customize the fallback in utils.ts export const FALLBACK_IMAGE_URL = 'your-custom-fallback-image.png'; ``` ### Issue: Animations not playing **Solution:** Ensure the CSS file is properly imported: ```typescript import './components/HeroSection.css'; ``` ### Issue: Grid layout not responsive **Solution:** Check that the viewport meta tag is in your HTML: ```html ``` ### Issue: TypeScript errors **Solution:** Ensure all props match the interface: ```typescript // Correct // Incorrect - missing required properties ``` ## Performance Considerations - **Lazy loading** - Images use `loading="lazy"` attribute - **Optimized animations** - Uses CSS transforms for better performance - **Minimal rerenders** - Component only rerenders when props change - **No layout shifts** - Fixed image container heights prevent CLS ## Future Enhancements Consider adding these features: 1. **Search/Filter** - Allow users to search/filter starter packs 2. **Categories** - Group packs by technology/difficulty 3. **Favorites** - Let users bookmark their favorite packs 4. **Modal view** - Show detailed information in a modal 5. **Dark mode** - Toggle between light/dark themes 6. **Animations** - More sophisticated entrance animations 7. **Pagination** - Handle large numbers of starter packs ## Additional Resources - [React Documentation](https://react.dev/) - Official React docs - [MDN CSS Grid Guide](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_Grid_Layout) - Learn about CSS Grid - [Web Accessibility](https://www.w3.org/WAI/) - Accessibility guidelines - [Unsplash](https://unsplash.com/) - Source for placeholder images ## License MIT License - Feel free to use this in your projects. --- **Built with ‚ù§Ô∏è for Hackatbrown 2026**
